definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: He deeply regretted that he had taken the enemy too lightly.
sentences.chinese: 他後悔我自己過於輕敵了。

sentences.english: Today we have crossed his path and must not take him lightly.
The greatest disaster is to take your rivals lightly; Taking them lightly nearly cost me my treasures.
sentences.chinese: 最大的禍害是輕敵，輕敵幾乎能斷送我的寶貝。

sentences.english: The greatest disaster is to take your rivals lightly; Taking them lightly nearly cost me my treasures.
sentences.chinese: 最大的禍害是輕敵，輕敵幾乎能斷送我的寶貝。

sentences.english: The prince is careless lightly and lose the game.
sentences.chinese: 王子尚大意輕敵而輸掉比賽。

definition: to be in overall charge/to oversee
Vertical Alliance, clique of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
to fight with all one's might
to nurse a grievance/to harbor a grudge
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
